item.title: Taco details below!! Escaped to big bear for Labor Day !!! *I f...
item.description:
Taco details below!! Escaped to big bear for Labor Day !!! *I feel like this is a super simple dinner when in an air bnb! with minimal (to none) waste when traveling :’) it’s for sure my go-to loll Chicken thigh marinade: oil (olive or avocado), soy sauce, lime juice, taco seasoning packet (helps avoid buying a ton of spices), minced garlic -guac: 2-3 avocados, 1 lime juiced, 1 white onion diced, 1-2 tomatoes diced, cilantro, minced garlic, salt topped with cotija cheese! -tortillas of choice! -whatever I have left over from guac (limes, cilantro, onion, tomato, cheese, etc) I just use as toppings for the tacos !! So yum 😊 *also got chips and salsa hehe
FULL POST | EMBED | REVERSED

item.title: Dare I say... this is the OnlyPan I need? hehe more stainless st...
item.description:
Dare I say... this is the OnlyPan I need? hehe more stainless steel tips below! is currently offering up to 25% off cookware sets and 15% off individual items during their End of Season Sale. Use the link in my bio to save on your order today! *make sure the pan is preheated!! Head on medium heat for about 2-3 minutes. Use the water bead test as shown in the video to ensure it’s ready *always use a little oil before adding the food. I’d recommend a high smoke point oil *have patience and don’t try to move around the protein too soon, it’ll naturally release when ready! *deglazing is your friend! If you’re cooking and bits get stuck at the bottom, deglaze with water, broth or wine and continue cooking, it adds flavor! *to clean: wash with warm water and use a stainless steel cleaner. YOU GOT THIS!!!
@Made In Cookware #MadeinPartner #ad
FULL POST | EMBED | REVERSED

item.title: Recipe below :) This is the same chicken I used in the cabbage s...
item.description:
Recipe below :) This is the same chicken I used in the cabbage salad I made!! Ingredients: -1 lb chicken breast (butterflied) seasoned with salt, pepper, and generous amount of rice flour on both sides sauce: -2tsp sesame oil -2 minced garlic cloves -2tsp minced ginger -1tsp chili flakes -1/2c water -1/4c honey -3tbsp sriracha (or sub ketchup LMAO) -1tbsp soy sauce (or like 2.. or 3…) -1 lime juiced Garnishes: sesame seeds, lime, green onion Recipe: -mince garlic and ginger, set aside. Combine water, sriracha, soy sauce, lime, honey -prepare chicken and heat a pan on medium heat. Add 1-2tbsp neutral oil and cook the chicken for about 3 min per side. Remove from the pan -lower heat to med-low and add sesame oil, garlic and ginger. Cook until fragrant (30 seconds), add chili flakes and cook for another 1-2 min until the garlic starts to brown. Add sauce mixture and bring to a simmer for 3-5 min. OPTIONAL: cornstarch slurry to thicken (1/2tbsp corn starch and 1tbsp cold water mixed together) -add the chicken back and flip until fully coated! It’ll most likely be fully cooked from before but double check and cook longer if needed. Garnish and enjoy! I eat it with rice and whatever roasted veggies I got hahah
FULL POST | EMBED | REVERSED

item.title: good morning, recipe below!! Also happy international dog day to...
item.description:
good morning, recipe below!! Also happy international dog day to Stella (and your dog hehe)😎 Recipe: -using a fork poke holes in the sweet potato, cover in oil and bake at 425F for 45 min (until fully cooked through) -savory sweet potato: bacon, fried egg, feta and parsley (salt and pepper) -sweet sweet potato: Greek yogurt, bananas, blueberries, granola, chia seeds, cocoa nibs, honey, and peanut butter !! **my friend showed me some pics of this on Pinterest and I had to make it :’) not sure who’s original recipe it is. Highly recommend giving it a try
FULL POST | EMBED | REVERSED

item.title: Snack recipe below! Tune in to the NASCAR on NBC Daytona race to...
item.description:
Snack recipe below! Tune in to the NASCAR on NBC Daytona race tonight at 7:30 pm ET!!! @NASCARonNBC Ingredients: -Whipped ricotta: ricotta, olive oil, salt -Blistered tomatoes: cherry tomatoes, crushed garlic cloves, olive oil, salt, fresh thyme and rosemary -Baguette (sliced) -Yellow peaches (thinly sliced) -Fresh basil and mint -red chili flakes -lemon zest -hot honey Recipe: -drizzle bread slices with olive oil and broil (500F) for 5-10 min until golden brown. Remove and set aside -in a small saucepan add tomatoes, garlic, few tbsp of olive oil, pinch of salt, thyme and rosemary sprig. Simmer on low-med until the garlic is golden brown and the tomatoes are blistered and soft, stir occasionally (15ish min). remove herbs and set aside -whip together ricotta, 1/2tbsp olive oil, and a pinch of salt until smooth. You can use an electric whisk, blender, or food processor. add to a piping bag (or ziploc bag and cut off the end) TOMATO RICOTTA: to the bread add whipped ricotta, tomatoes, garlic, fresh basil and chili flakes PEACH RICOTTA: to the bread add whipped ricotta, sliced peach, mint, hot honey and lemon zest enjoy!! :)
@Peacock @NBC Sports #Peacock #PeacockPartner
FULL POST | EMBED | REVERSED
